intro: Cissus wallichiana, commonly known as the Indian stonecrop, is a climbing plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by bright red berries. It is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in shaded environments. Cissus wallichiana is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
